strings.Value: "How are things in Varnhold?"
"Have you taken care of Varnhold's defenses?"
"Do you remember anything from when your soul was imprisoned?"
"I should go."
"How do you find the capital?"
"In your room, I discovered a letter containing threats. Is there something you'd like to discuss with me?"
"How did Jamandi react when Varnhold joined my barony?"
"How do you like being Treasurer?"
"I'm thinking about offering you an official position. In what way could you help me govern the country?"
"Remind me, what did you ask me to do?"
{n}When he sees you, Maegar gives you a polite bow.{/n} "Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}! Welcome back. How can I serve you?"
"Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}! To what do I owe the pleasure?"

"The people have already reconstructed the fort walls, even started digging a moat around the town and organizing patrols. That event was... a real shock to everyone. So now every citizen of {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g}, young or old, has been doing everything in their power to never be caught off guard again."

"Excellent, Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}, everything is excellent. Sure, when everyone returned home, they were a bit uncomfortable. But after appointing a deputy and doubling the guards, the citizens began to calm down, and life started returning to normal."

{n}Maegar hesitates a moment, then finally says,{/n} "You saved us all, Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}, and I'll never be able to thank you enough for that. All I can do is serve you faithfully and ensure your efforts weren't in vain. {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g} will stand strong, no matter what. This, I promise you!"

{n}Maegar freezes.{/n} "I'm... n-not sure, Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}." {n}The man frowns.{/n} "It was... dark. Almost no space..." {n}He closes his eyes and gulps.{/n} "If... if you don't mind, I'd rather not recall any more."
{n}Maegar looks around the hall, squinting.{/n} "It's impressive. Still, sometimes I just miss the open spaces of {g|Dunsward}Dunsward{/g}."

"To be blunt, Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}, who cares? Maybe she's angry back in {g|Restov}Restov{/g}, or crying her head off, or even celebrating. Matters not — the issue's already been settled between the two of us."

{n}Maegar's face darkens.{/n} "I didn't want you to know about that. Wanted to spare you from any further worries... I began receiving letters like that one since about when I sent you trading goods."
"Once, my men even interrogated the trader who delivered the mail, but nothing came of it. I have some assumptions of who's behind it, but as long as I have no proof, I don't want to accuse anyone."

{n}Maegar shakes his head.{/n} "Sometimes it's hard, other times — less so. But overall it's nothing special. The chests in the treasury are fine, all the records are in order, and as for all the pressing issues, I can simply address them to you."

{n}Maegar gives you a crooked smile, and shakes his head.{/n} "Eh, no, Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}. I've been there before, and it seemed my advices didn't do much good. You should find someone else to help you."

"I can't say ruling a barony used to give me much joy — there are far more enjoyable pursuits. But if there was something I really excelled at, it was managing {g|Varnhold}Varnhold's{/g} treasury. If I hadn't been there, our citizens would have had to tighten their belts!"

{n}Maegar looks grim and gaunt.{/n} "{mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}! I don't know if you're interested, but I attempted on my own to discover the fate of my people who stayed behind in that dungeon. I was only able to recover the remains of one person from the party, but I suspect the others are dead as well." {n}He looks away.{/n} "I suppose we should consider the matter settled."

"To help me learn the fate of my people, who were down in that mysterious dungeon when Varnhold fell under Vordakai's spell. Cephal and I went down some of the way with them, but then had to hurry back to Varnhold, and I still don't know what happened."
